DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate the analgesia efficacy of local ketamine given by two different techniques in pediatric patients undergoing tonsillectomy operations
DOC.brief_title: Topical Ketamine Analgesia in Children Undergoing Tonsillectomy: a Clinical and Serum Level Assays Study.
DOC.detailed_description: In this double-blinded, clinically-controlled trial, 60 child will be randomized into three groups of 20 patients each; intravenous ketamine group received 0.5mg iv. ketamine, and two local ketamine groups receiving local ketamine by nebulization in two different doses; 0.5 and 1mg/kg. The verbal rating pain scale, time to first postoperative analgesic request, total analgesic consumption during 1st 24 h postoperative, serum ketamine levels, intra operative blood loss, postoperative bleeding, and adverse effects were evaluated.
DOC.criteria: ASA physical status III patients aged 712 years and scheduled for elective tonsillectomy due to recurrent or chronic tonsillitis will be included in the study patients with known hypersensitivity to medication drugs, coagulation disorders, thrombocytopenia, and significant cardiac, renal, pulmonary or hepatic disease.
